captions.text:
How you feel about the Lamborghini
Huracan is largely determined by your
mental age.

The poster hanging twelve-year-old
within all of us will look at it and say

Wow! But the sober, rational adult will
look at and say well it's just an
overpriced Audio R8 in a Countach body kit.
Also it's so low to the ground it scrapes on
shadow. And it rides like an epileptic horse!
Plus this paint: it's so obnoxious they might as well call the color
'Kanye'. But that twelve-year-old
might turn 13 and say "dude there's a 610 horsepower
naturally aspirated V10 mounted right behind your head and

connected to a lightning-quick dual
clutch transmission
and all-wheel-drive grip" How old am I,
mentally? You're gonna find out in about 20 seconds.

So I'm a middle-aged man living out my
twelve-year-old fantasy.
This car the Huracan.
(laughs)
Okay what i'm talking about: looks there isn't a bad angle I've been staring at this
thing for a week and it works it just works.
It's actually a nice homage to the great Lambos of the past.
The front clearly you see the Countach especially there's
these triangular sections on the hood.  The Mira.

Especially from the rear now if you look
at the rear of a Mira and I try to do that
once a week
you will notice they kinda took the rear end of a Mira and flipped it upside down
and that's the rear of the Huracan.

I've had a Lamborghini hanging on a
wall
where I've lived since I was about 11

and much to my wife's chagrin that's
still true.
I would get a poster of this I would get a Huracan poster.
Just knockout design, knockout design!

Speaking of knockout we gotta talk about
performance.
The Huracan can hit sixty miles an hour in 2.8 seconds.

Extremely quick for a naturally aspirated
car. This Lamborghini's
quarter mile time is ridiculous.
10.6 seconds at 132.8 miles per hour.
That quarter mile time means not only is this
faster than a GTR, a Nismo GTR this is the quickest
accelerating naturally
aspirated car we've ever tested. In fact the only cars we've tested that are faster than the
Huracan are:
the Bugatti Veyron, the McLaren P1
and the Porsche 918. And all of those start at over a million bucks.

And that's just straight line this thing
corners too.
It has a max lateral acceleration of 1.02 G's
and the Huracan can runaround our figure 8 in 23 seconds flat
with the remarkable average G of 0.98.
So numbers are one thing and again
P Zeros are not the most aggressive tires we could have had ont he car. But
what I'm notice when driving this thing around the figure 8
it is by far the most controllable car I've ever

figure 8-ed. It'll just do whatever you
want. My technique
you know I would I would come in hot, trail break.and sort of

rotate the car a little bit and then one
steering angle
and just right foot to steer the car through. And just whap it on
the way out,
and oversteer tire smoke unbelievable.
Anthony my camera guy right here can

bench press an Audi but I had him
squealing like a little girl
and the thing is just it's so aggressive.
Just an amazing vehicle. So think about it
Ferrari 488 turbos, McLarens turbos,
Huracan? Natural aspiration
that makes this the last man standing it's the last
naturally aspirated entry-level supercar
you can buy. And I applaud
keeping it that way: awesome!
And the sound? I mean
come on nothing beats naturally aspiration.
Not only in terms of sound
and again V10 is not the most melodious engine but I love this one
but in terms of revving and then degrading
and that's part of the reason why it's so controllabe is when you do
come off the throttle revs drop and
you get real engine braking and it's useful and use that to control
What was happening when I was driving the Huracan around

the part of my brain that jingles wnen I'm in
something really special

it was twitching and I'm talking about you
know what happens
when you drive cars like the Ferrari 458 Italia or the
Bugatti Veyron.
Two of the most incredible machines I've ever driven and
Huracan is just as good!
If not better I mean
tall package this the supercar
All rights so Randy brought you out to Big Willow
with the kermit the Lambo here because

I've been driving this car for a week
and I'm

very impressed with it. More so than
most other cars I've ever driven

driving a lot of cars driven a lot but I
don't worry that my opinion of
it is too high

so I wanna pro driver tell me I'm crazy
it's not that good.
We're thinking of power now.
Yeah
Feels light to me he said 3400 pounds right? I think 3409.
Yeah.
It feels like 2500 pounds.
Light.
Even though it has stability
it's not understeering.
It's a balanced car.
And i'm all about the balance.
Which is again
a brutal car. Fast
but you know it's all wheel drive.
this
capabilities of more
of a GTR
but it adds all this fun and thrill
driving involvement
that the GTR does not.
I'm going to go up this hill.
Yeah it just digs.

Every other car we drive your gets all
sideways right there on the left
turn 3.

Including the 918 with an
all-wheel-drive. Yeah that's true

To me the Huracan is a lot like the
Hellcat and here's why
my whole life I've been staring at

pictures of muscle cars dreaming that
they will actually
be as good as they look right? I gotcha.

Tthey will be really fast and the brakes 
will be good and they'll turn and muscle cars
generally stick.
Right and then you drive a '65 Mustang GT
yeah. And it's horrible! Yeah we've both driven
Countach. Horrible. It's the worst car I've ever driven. It's still
my favorite but a horrible car to hard drive.
But this one though it's about as good looking as a mid engine car can get.
It answers the supercar promise
it really is super!
It doesn't just look super.
It drives super.
Light on the gas I'm talking with my hands. THis was not the Lambo
Oh no it was white knuckle the whole time.
I remember I was talking with Valentino Balboni about the Countach
and I remember we were just discussing various
aspects of the car and he got to the brakes and he made the sign of the cross.
(laughs)
I mean this car's not like that.

It's a modern car that setting a new
standard I'm
for handling. I agree.

There is a weak point though yeah and
maybe

because race car so good it makes it
more obvious it's the braking.

The ABS is not as sophisticated as the
best other cars we've tried.
For instance the good old Corvette and the Z28.
The humble Camaro Z28.
This car's ABS allows quite a bit of lockup.
It doesn't like being pushed too hard the ABS.

That's where there's room for
improvement on the
Huracan
is in the brakes.
That's it!
Lamborghini was always kind of a wannabe when it came to driving.
They looked cool they were a little more exotic than Ferrari
but they just didn't drive like a good Ferrari. Well now the
gauntlet has been thrown.
Alright we're about to run out of gasoline so we should probably haul it in.
While refueling we decided to look at the tires.
No surprise they're pretty much shot.
Off came the factory P zeros on went a non factory set of Trofeo-Rs.

Hey blame the Lamborghini engineers they
brought them.
The Huracan
ran around Big Willow's 2.4 mile track
in 1 minute 25.17 seconds.

Make it quicker than any production car
we've

ever tested except for one: Porsche 918
Spyder.

When Ferutio Lamborghini founded his
car company the promise was

that his car's would be better than
Ferrari's. It took him 52 years
but Lambo finally did it.
Boy I'm high when I get out of the car.
I'm high on one of those drugs that come out: adrenaline.
Pheremones? Something's coming up.
Proprioceptors that make me tickle. It just makes me feel that good
to drive this car hard.
Oh yeah.

It's better than any Ferrari I've ever
driven.
The best Ferrari I  ever drove was a 458.
I've driven a lot of Ferraris too I've driven most of them. I'm glowing so

ebulently about this car that it sounds
like
we're trying to sell it. They've leapfrogged Ferrari here for a moment
we'll see if Ferrari can
out do this car with its
next
generation. If Ferrari ever gives us another car which is a whole other story (laugh).
Hi there!

title: 2014 Lamborghini Huracan LP 610-4: The One We’ve Been Waiting Half a Century For? - Ignition Ep. 128

comments.author: MCADJim

comments.text:
Lamborghini makes beautiful cars but I'd choose a Ferrari over one any day. 
However, with all the appreciation that I have for the beautiful machines 
that Lamborghini makes they feel like they're losing touch with design. 
Every Lamborghini looks almost identical, they change up the headlights and 
taillights for different models but the overall frame just screams the 
past, and lets not rule out the interior designs, Lamborghini has some 
serious issues with whomever is designing the interior. Please Lamborghini, 
give us better interior. Another problem that I have with Lamborghini is 
the fat quarter panels on these new Lambos, every model seems like it has a 
fat exterior on a small frame. With all that said, Lamborghini has done 
well with the exterior of this new Huracan but it just feels like they took 
an Aventador and tweaked the exterior a little, and it still could use a 
better interior.﻿

comments.text:
Hey Johnny! Obviously, I`ve never driven any of the cars you test, partly 
because I live in Norway where everything cost a millon trillion, and 
partly because I`m a normal human being. I have a question for you though. 
You seem to mention various Chevys a lot in almost all of your videos, and 
while I realize they`ve gone through a revolution of sorts, it does not 
always seem to relevant. Do you guys have some kind of arrangement or 
affiliation with Chevrolet, or comparing euro/japanese cars with Chevys 
just a way to get americans a reference point they can understand better?﻿
